Fossil fuel subsidies contradict fight against climate change.
"The principle is simple and clear: You can’t really say you’re committed to the fight against climate change if you’re still funding oil and coal.
Ending fossil fuel subsidies would cut emissions.
International Energy Agency (IEA), the G-20 said that "eliminating fossil fuel subsidies by 2020 would reduce greenhouse gas emissions in 2050 by ten percent.
Money subsidizing oil could go toward subsidizing clean energy.
US President Barack Obama: "We need to get behind this clean tech innovation.
Ending oil subsidies is good for air quality, human health.
"The president got it right ," said Frances Beinecke, president of the Natural Resources Defense Council, in a statement.
If no cap-and-trade, ending fossil fuels is close second.
"It’s so obvious, you can’t really believe it hasn’t happened sooner.
Oil subsidies essential until clean tech becomes viable alternative.

"Oil subsidies, while certainly not something that should be maintained in the long term, are essential to the US Economy until a viable, economical and environmentally sound alternative presents itself.
Some "fossil fuels" are worth subsidizing for environment.
Not all fossil fuels are the same.
Ending oil subsidies levels playing field for clean energy.
Supporters of oil subsidies contend that oil subsidies are necessary because clean energy is not yet viable and the economy remains dependent on oil.
Subsidizing clean energy and not oil will allow rapid transition.
Ideally, renewables, the necessary fuel of the future, should be subsidized, and fossil fuels should not be.
Far more subsidies go to oil than renewables.

"The financial consultancy, based in London, estimated that around $45 billion or so was doled out in subsidies for renewable energy sources like wind and solar power in 2009, noting how this compares to the most recent International Energy Agency estimate of global subsidies propping up fossil fuels.
Appropriate that oil more heavily subsidized than renewables.
"Some environmentalists try to turn this situation to their tactical advantage by comparing these figures to the much lower absolute level of subsidy given to renewables.
Subsidizing oil companies does not lower global prices.
"Oil subsidies don’t help consumers at the pump.
Hugely profitable oil companies do not need subsidies.
"You may recall that a couple of months ago, Republicans in the Senate threatened a filibuster to defend about $13 billion in oil company subsidies.
Unsubsidized oil giants need not raise prices.
Some supporters of subsidies argue that oil prices would increase if subsidies are eliminated.
Subsidies are just generally inefficient.
Subsidies are in essence payments by the government to keep an ineffective firm in business, or, in other words, payments for no goods produced or services provided (such as subsidies for farmers).
Subsidies can reduce price incentive to conserve oil.
"Across the developing world, governments are subsidizing energy, blunting the incentive to conserve by keeping prices low.
Fossil fuels critical to modern economies.
"Everything in the US Economy relies on transportation.
Subsidizing oil helps promote economic growth.

"The whole lesson to learn here is, when entities, bureaucratic governmental entities realize that growth is necessary, they realize that energy must be affordable and it has to be as cheap as it can be for people.
Subsidizing oil can help create and keep jobs.

Jack Gerard, President of the American Petrochemical Institute: "It's unfortunate that the administration seems poised to stifle what remains one of America's strongest job creating industries by phasing out fossil fuel subsidies.
Some oil subsidies are national security necessities.
Oil subsidies for a emergency reserve of oil supplies are a good example of a kind of subsidy that should not be eliminated.
Ending subsidies for oil companies will save tens of billions.
Cutting subsidies to oil companies will save 45 billion over ten years according to the Center for American Progress.
Oil subsidies better spent on education, health care, etc.
"They are expensive, sucking in public money that might be better used on, say, health care or education.
Oil subsidies will get more expensive as oil prices rise.
"Oil subsidies get costlier as the price of oil rises, which explains why some countries, including China and India, have allowed domestic energy prices to rise somewhat.
Fossil fuels subsidies are a worthy expenditure.
It is true that fossil fuel subsidies are in the hundreds of billions of dollars range.
Fossil fuel subsidies are relatively small.
A couple hundred billion dollars in subsidies is not an outrageous number, given the size and importance of the fossil fuel industry.
Fossil fuel subsidies mainly benefit gas-guzzling wealthy.
"Governments in developing countries say they must shield the poor from high energy prices.
Subsidies don't decrease oil prices.
As outlined above, subsidies of individual oil companies do not lower global oil prices.
Oil subsidies shield poor from high oil prices.
This is one of the most important functions played by subsidies; helping ensure that the poor do not have to spend an even greater share of their limited monthly budgets on oil and electricity bills.
Oil subsidies do not reduce foreign dependencies.
"Tax subsidies for oil companies don’t decrease our reliance on foreign oil.
Subsidizing domestic production reduces foreign dependencies.

There is not doubt that in places like the United States, there are very large domestic supplies of fossil fuels that can - if explored-for, found, and tapped - supply huge quantities of domestic energy.
Oil industry pays millions to scare Congress into maintaining subsidies.
"BP and ExxonMobil, pay lobbyists millions of dollars to scare lawmakers into believing that ending subsidies to oil companies will wreak havoc on the American economy.
The Pickens Plan will stimulate the US economy.
"A big wind plan would be good for the economy, particularly in the nation's job-starved rural areas.
Pickens makes beneficial long-term investments in electric grid.
It is common knowledge that the US electric grid is outdated.
Pickens Plan provides a good test case.
Dan Becker, director of the Safe Climate Campaign, said, in regards to the Pickens Plan, "We really need to kick the tires on this and see what works".
That the Pickens Plan is for profit is a good thing.
"Will he make a profit if his plan is enacted? Of course, since he is the biggest developer of wind power in the country.
Pickens energy plan is very expensive.
"The plan comes with a staggering price tag, even by Pickens's own estimates: a trillion U.
Pickens Plan requires infeasible electric grid upgrades.
"Despite the high costs, Pickens touts the economic growth the expanded wind farm industry could provide.
Pickens Plan favors technology over better market guidance.

John DeCicco, a senior fellow with Environmental Defense - "You can’t pick today what’s going to work in the marketplace tomorrow, the best you can do for policy is to set a general goal in terms of carbon reductions – put a price on carbon - and then let the market sort out what it the technological solution is going to be, not Pickens, not President Bush, not Senator so- and so.
Pickens Plan relies too heavily on subsidization.

Rob Bradley, founder and chairman of IER, issued the following statement - "The Pickens plan relies on special government mandates and subsidies to pick the pockets of American taxpayers and ratepayers.
Wind energy is a renewable resource than can replace coal.
Wind is a renewable resource that relies on the energy of the wind to generate electricity, burning no fuel and contributing no greenhouse gases to the global warming problem.
Pickens Plan wind turbines will produce significant energy.
"The Plan calls for building new wind generation facilities that will produce 20% of our nation's electricity and allow us to use natural gas as a transportation fuel.
Pickens Plan is feasible application of wind technology.
"On the face of it, the Pickens Plan is not at all radical.
Inconsistent wind energy in Pickens Plan can be accommodated.

"The biggest complaint about wind power -- that it is an intermittent resource -- can be solved with emerging storage technologies, including plug-in hybrid vehicles that recharge at night when the wind blows best and feed electricity back into the grid during the day when the vehicles are parked at home or work.
Replacing natural gas with inconsistent wind energy is unwise.
"The inconsistency of wind energy underscores one reason it might not be wise to take natural gas out of the U.
Wind energy production is inconsistent relative to demand.

"Sweden’s gleaming wind park is entering service at a time when wind energy is coming under sharper scrutiny, not just from hostile neighbors, who complain that the towers are a blot on the landscape, but from energy experts who question its reliability as a source of power.
Wind energy is non-dispatchable.
"Unfortunately, energy consumers can’t tell the wind to blow more when they need more electricity.
Better ways to cut oil consumption than Pickens Plan.
Vaclav Smil, a professor of environment at the University of Manitoba in Canada.
Wind energy frees up natural gas to be used in cars.
A significant quantity of natural gas is used to produce electricity.
Pickens wisely replaces oil imports with domestic natural gas.
"Pickens’ plan to substitute natural gas for imported oil is consistent with national policy today, but that policy needs to be revised.
Pickens Plan exploits abundant US natural gas resources.
Natural gas is abundant in the United States.
Natural gas is about half as expensive as gasoline.
Natural gas is much cheaper than gasoline.
The natural gas infrastructure already exists.
Natural gas is already widely used in the United States.
It is relatively cheap to convert existing cars to natural gas.
New cars need not be built to run on natural gas.
Pickens Plan wrongly diverts natural gas from replacing coal.
"That brings us to the second part of Pickens’ plan and to Joe’s correct judgment that using natural gas to run vehicles rather than power plants is a bad idea.
Renewable vehicles better than Pickens' natural gas cars.
"Advocates of NGVs claim that with the right government support, natural gas could displace more than 10 billion gallons of gasoline equivalent by 2017.
Pickens Plan for natural gas vehicles will increase gas prices.

"Large industrial users of natural gas, like chemical companies and utilities, have been struggling with gas prices that have sometimes spiked to extraordinary levels in recent years, and they would not welcome a new source of demand.
Pickens plan use of natural gas vehicles is unwise.
"the notion of a mass migration to natural gas vehicles — now less than 1 percent of the country’s highway fleet — is not universally welcomed.
Wind requires natural gas back-up .
"Wind energy needs backup power that comes mostly from natural-gas fired power plants.
The Pickens Plan is generally a good idea.
Rich Kolodziej, president of NGVAmerica, a national organization that promotes the use of hydrogen and natural gas vehicles.
The Pickens Plan is generally not viable.
Clay Perry, of the Electric Power Research Institute - "I don’t think this is a viable plan.
PHEV's can substantially reduce carbon emissions.
PHEV's can increase drive-train efficiency results and significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
PHEV's can act as "back-up batteries" for grid and lower emissions.
PHEV's can lower a country’s carbon emissions by acting as a "back-up battery" for the national grid because they can operate in a mode called "vehicle to grid".
Plug-in hybrids can help reduce smog.
The Ontario Medical Association announced that smog is responsible for an estimated 9,500 premature deaths in the Ontario every year.
Plug-In Hybrids increase demand for dirty electricity.
Electricity is expensive and the production is hardly pollution-free.
The need for oil would hardly be reduced.
Half of the oil drilled is not even used for fuel, but rather plastics, pills, vaseline, machines lubricants, bags, make-up, clothing, carpet, computer components, T.
The operating costs of PHEVs are lower than gasoline cars.
The cost for electricity to power plug-in hybrids for all-electric operation has been estimated at less than one quarter of the cost of gasoline.
Surveys indicate strong market potential for plug-in hybrids.
Potential will grow over time as public familiarity with the technology increases.
Plug-in hybrids can increase national energy independence.
PHEV's can shift the car’s primary energy source from petrol to electricity.
PHEV's are quieter than combustion vehicles.
A major annoyance and even social problem in urban areas and around freeways, is the noise that combustion engines make.
The shift to electricity may cause black-outs in many areas.
In the short-run if PHEVs are used at mass, it will certainly trigger the problem already existing in so many places.
Polygamy is O.K. as long as multi-partner relations of all kinds are also allowed.
These could include women marrying multiple husbands, or gay, lesbian, and even bisexual partners.
Polygamy can't undermine marriage any more than it is undermining itself.
The institution of marriage is already broken, with divorce rates as high as 50% in many countries.
Polygamy undermines the traditional institution of marriage.
Polygamy undermines the traditional institution of marriage, trivializing the union of two people.
Polygamous men cannot reciprocate equally the love they receive from their wives.
Carrying for a wife is about more than supplying her with material needs, something polygamist husbands are frequently capable of doing for their many wives.
Polygamy leaves some men with no women to marry.
With an essentially 1:1 male to female ration in the world, a man that accumulates three wives can be seen as depriving two other men of wives.
Large polygamous families generally enjoy lower quality of life.
"With all things being equal, the quality of life for a family decreases as the family size increases.
Polygamous family dynamics are complicated and unstable.
"Polyamorists emphasize that multipartner unions take intense and constant work.
Polygamy does nothing to reduce the impulse toward adultery outside of the household.
Adultery is based on a desire for the ‘other’, for something outside the known, outside the home.
Men have an inherent desire to have many wives and "multiply".
Men have an inherent desire to mate very frequently.
Polygamy ensures men don't shirk commitments to those they have sex with.
Polygamy encourages men to make a commitment to those that they have sex with, as opposed to only having sex with them once because they possess another wife.
Polygamy allows men to avoid controlling their sexual impulses.
Men should be able to control their sexual impulses with reason and control.
With a lower availability of women, polygamy creates bitter competitions between men.
When a few men win all the wives in a community, many men are left without wives and the opportunity to live fulfilling lives with a lover, sex, and children.
Polygamy is an empowering lifestyle for women.
"Polygamy is an empowering lifestyle for women.
Polygamous families provide women with an ideal support network.

"Now if polygamy came back into vogue, women in such marriages could form an amicable sorority, taking on duties they liked rather than what is imposed on them as wife, mother and homemaker in most monogamous relationships.
Polygamy provides wives with a sisterhood of life-long friends.
Polygamous wives often consider themselves in a loving sisterhood or sorority, in which they are best friends with their "sister wives".
Jealousies between polygamous wives can be contained with a sense of sisterhood.

Jealousies between polygamous wives can be contained with a sense of "sisterhood"  - "The question is, can petty jealousies be kept in check? They could if the wives thought of themselves as a sisterhood.
Polygamous women can choose the right husband, even if he is married.
Women shouldn't have to pass-up a man that they fall in love with simply because they are married.
Polygamy is not about increasing sex for men, but security for women.
"The point was not to facilitate more sex for men, but to give best protection to the women.
Polygamous women can scrutinize married men in action before marrying.
Women that are interested in marrying a polygamous man, benefit from seeing how he acts with his other wives, and thus achieve confidence in what they will get as future wives.
Polygamous wives have security of husbands not having to divorce to re-marry.
Women, being aware that men are promiscuous and desirous creatures, worry that their husbands will fall in love with other women, and divorce them to be with those other women.
Polygamy is only appropriate when a man can provide for more than one wife.
"Polygamy means to protect, to take care of and maintain the wife.
Many women join polygamous families to climb the social ladder.
It is OK for women to join polygamous marriages in order to climb the social ladder.
Polygamy makes individual wives feel that they are insufficient.
"There is good reason to outlaw polygamy.
Polygamy is traumatizing and depressing for wives.

"As a clinical psychologist who has treated women formerly involved in plural marriages, I can attest that the effects on them are devastating: profound depression, post-traumatic stress disorder, sexually transmitted diseases and poverty, among many others.
Polygamous women do not receive a fair commitment from their husbands.
Marriage is largely about committing to a woman.
Older wives suffer when new wives enter a polygamous marriage.
"I've been following accounts of polygamous societies ever since I saw an article in the early 1980s about a Kenyan man with 150 wives.
Competition between wives for husband's attention erodes the sisterhood.
While a sisterhood can emerge among polygamous women, it is typically undercut by jealousy and competition between them for the attention of their husband.
Polygamy fosters the spread of venereal diseases.
As a husband has unprotected sex with his many wives, venereal diseases are commonly spread around.
Polygamy leaves women sexually unsatisfied and prone to adultery.
Women have strong sex drives; often equally as strong as men.
Legalizing polygamy will cause all women to worry about husbands pursue new wives.
If polygamy is legalized, does that mean that all existing husbands in monogamous marriages can all of a sudden seek additional wives? If so, this will create great worry among married women.
Anti-polygamy police raids traumatize children.
Raids by police of polygamous sects, and the division of children from their mothers is a highly traumatizing experience for children.
Legalization will allow polygamist to send children to mainstream education.
The illegality of polygamy forces polygamists to live in the shadows of society.
Polygamous fathers can't give their children adequate attention.
"In polygamous households, the father invests less time in the upbringing of his children, because there are more of them.
The children of older wives suffer when new wives enter a polygamous marriage.
New wives in polygamous families are often the subject of great attention from their husbands.
Polygamy subjects children to an environment of rivalry and insecurity.
Children realize that the attention they receive from their father is conditioned in large part on the presence of other siblings and the nature of their mother's relationship to the father.
Polygamy forces children into a life they often don't want.
The children lose because they are being forced to work and doing things that they don't want to.
Any problems with polygamous couples can be remedied.
Any legal complications that could arise are either easily remedied or are already being dealt with in the courts for monogamous couples.
Recognizing polygamy would cause a host of legal problems.

Regardless of whether polyamorous relationships are appropriate or if it's appropriate for people to have polygamous marriage ceremonies in religious institutions the benefits provided by legally recognized marriage pose serious problems.
Porn can inspire and educate for better sex.
Pornography can be seen as a mean to improving one's sexual life, as an inspiring source of visual stimuli.
Porn along with controlled masturbation improves performance.
Sex therapists often recommend using masturbation as practise for sex.
Porn improves self-control with distance from sex.

Watching other people performing a sexual act can help one to fully perceive and realize the actual absurdity and emptiness of sex (from the conscious point of view), hereby enabling one to build-up a healthy distance from the whole issue.
Porn can serve as a  substitute for sex life.
For people that (for various reasons) doesn't have a sexual life, pornography can (partially) serve as its substitute.
Ordinary sex can rarely live up to pornography.
Porn "deadens Our Erotic Senses" according to Will at The League of Ordinary Gentlemen in 2010.
Porn weakens libido and contributes to impotency.
"For the first time in human history, the images’ power and allure have supplanted that of real naked women.
Porn makes women seem less attractive to men.
"The onslaught of porn is responsible for deadening male libido in relation to real women, and leading men to see fewer and fewer women as “porn-worthy.
Porn leaves men feeling empty and upset with themselves.
David McLeod, a marketing executive, said to the Guardian in a 2003: "You can easily get too much of it.
Pornography does not count as adultery.
"What counts as adultery is a function of the understanding, explicit or implicit, a particular couple has.
Porn is no substitute for gratification of relationships.
"The more relevant problem is what we might call, loosely, betrayal of exclusive initimacy.
Watching pornography can amount to adultery.
Porn is a "continuum of betrayal.
Porn degrades human romance to mere sex.
It debases human interactions by eliminating love, laughter and all other emotions, and reducing them to the crudely sexual.
Pornography increases likelihood of breakup/divorce.
Pornography is known to be highly addictive.
Pornography encourages promiscuity and shallow relationships.
Ray Wyre, a specialist in sexual crime, said to the Guardian in 2003 that pornography "encourages transience, experimentation and moving between partners.
Porn strokes the ego of the viewer.
Azrael Sky.
Porn provides knowledge that builds confidence.
Many porn watchers enjoy learning new positions and moves, ways to hold their partners, and things that they can say to turn on their partner when having sex.
Pornography is good for economic mobility.
Pornography is arguably bigger than any of the major league sports, with $10 billion to 14 billion in sales,according to Frank Rich.
Porn only serves to fill a void in people's hearts.
Psychoanalyst Estela Welldon, author of the classic text Mother, Madonna: "People who use pornography feel dead inside, and they are trying to avoid being aware of that pain.
Porn is akin to a drug addiction.
"Imagine a drug so powerful it can destroy a family simply by distorting a man’s perception of his wife.
Pornography lets women articulate femininity.
Pornography benefits women as well as men.
Pornography does not denigrate/harm women.
"Does Porn Harm Women? The most common concern about pornography is that it indirectly hurts women by encouraging sexism, raising sexual expectations and thereby harming relationships.
Porn creates good paying jobs for men and women.
Azrael Sky.
Porn generates money for the economy.
Azrael Sky.
Pornography degrades women.
Pornography objectives women, sometimes men, by making the intimate experience of sex into a voyeuristic act of gratification.
Porn makes women less confident of meeting expectations.
A comment was cited in a 2010 Huffington Post article: "My boyfriend says he's unable to perform sexually due to his porn use.
Porn-watching is one-sidedly dominated by men.
"women are more likely to look at pornography than in the past, but they remain considerably more hostile to porn than men are, and considerably less likely to make use of it.
Pornography is physically harmful toward female bodies.
Pornography inflicts permanent harm on the woman's body.
Porn leads women down destructive/futureless path.
"Forget all the liberal talk about women choosing to become "empowered" via porn.
Porn helps men "get even" with women for unfulfilled fantasies.
Bill Margold, one of the industry's longest-serving film performers, was interviewed in 1991 by psychoanalyst Robert Stoller for his book "Porn: Myths For The Twentieth Century.
Pornography does not make watchers more aggressive.
"Contrary to what many people believe, recent research shows that moderate pornography consumption does not make users more aggressive, promote sexism or harm relationships.
Porn helps men sublimate impulses toward rape.
While many argue that porn incites men to commit rape, there's also evidence in the opposite direction: that it helps men sublimate their aggressive sexual fantasies in a relatively harmless ways.
Rape will exist with or without pornography.
It is likely that if one is subject to the feelings rapists are then one is more inclined to use pornography, not the other way round - pornography does not create rapists.
Rape has existed before the invention of pornography.
Rape has existed for thousands of years, well before the invention of pornography.
Porn watching may actually reduce rape rates.
"What if it turns out that ­pornography use actually reduces the desire to rape? It is a controversial idea, but some studies support it.
Many rapists are obsessed with and encouraged by pornography.
by letting them treat women as objects whose feelings are not relevant, or as people who are actually wanting to be raped; a very common defence case is that a woman was ‘asking for it’.
Violent pornography encourages violence against women.
and fosters the normalization of rape.
Porn addiction escalates into increasingly aberrant acts.
"pornography addiction is a process that undergoes four phases.
Pornography further victimizes sexual abuse victims.
Pornography plays on sexual abuse victims' traumatic experiences.
Pornography is an expression falling under freedom of speech.
Free speech is an ideal we cherish.
Outlawing pornography infringes on minorities' free speech.
By outlawing "sexist" porn, these laws hurt minority porn more than the intended sexist porn.
Porn creates interesting/stimulating controversy.
"5 reasons why porn is good for society.
Porn not victimless.
Pornography encourages unhealthy, objectifying attitudes towards the opposite sex.
Porn often connected with organized crime/enslavement.
Pornography is a billion dollar industry that feeds human trafficking in which poor third world and eastern European women are sold against their will -- literally becoming sex slaves.
Debate over merits of porn usually don't relate to ban.

Usually, the debate over pornography does not relate to whether it should be banned as a whole, but rather whether individuals should continue to watch it, whether it can be healthy in marriages, whether hotels should offer it, whether prisoners should be allowed access, etc.

Parents have the reproductive right to select the gender of their children.
Parent have reproductive rights that allow them to determine when and where they want to have children.
Parents are free to select the gender of children and shape their family.

Why shouldn’t would-be parents be able to do this, given that no harm is done to others by their decision? Article 16 (1) of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights states that: "Men and women of full age… have the right to marry and to found a family.
It is good for parents to be happy with the gender of a child.
This is true, for example, when they already have six sons but want a daughter.
Freedom of choice should not be allowed when it harms children.
Freedom of choice is a good principle, but harm is done to others by the practice of sex selection and so it should not be allowed.
Sexual selection will reinforce gender stereotypes.

Apart from the danger that serious gender imbalances will result (covered in point 3 below), making some sort of sexual selection legal and acceptable will reinforce and legitimise gender stereotypes.
Parental gender choices make it more likely their child will be loved.
If parents are granted their wish to have a child of a certain gender, they are more likely to be happy and love their child.
Gender selection makes love for children conditional.
Our culture should not teach that children should be loved only on the condition that they meet the interests and desires of parents.
Gender selection will caste unfair expectations over children.
Michael J.
"Designer baby" fears are exaggerated.
Individuals do not procreate randomly: they choose their partners, and often choose the time of conception according to their own age and prosperity.
The technology is not really there to create designer babies.
Kathy Hudson, director of the Genetics and Public Policy Center at Johns Hopkins University, quoted in a 2004 Washington Post article.
Gender selection creates a slippery slope to designer babies.
This is an extension of the consumer society.
Allowing sex selection enables parents to meet cultural expectations.
Some cultures place great importance on having at least one child of a particular gender.
Sex selection does not result in parents favoring boys.
David L.
Sexual selection will re-enforce gender discrimination.
Women are already seen, in the majority of cultures as less valuable than men.
Gender selection will not result in demographic imbalances.

If a state’s population became seriously imbalanced, one might have to rethink: but given that most countries, including all in the West, do not, and given that many families in most countries will choose to have roughly as many of the other sex, this should not stop this proposal being put into effect in many countries.
Gender selection will likely result in demographic imbalances.
Selective abortion has meant that gender imbalance in China and India is already very, very high – 1.
Knowing the gender of a child is very helpful for planning purposes.
It is hardly shattering the mystery of childbirth, given how common ultrasound scans are.
Having a child is a process of wonder and awe, not planning and practicality.
These proposals make having children to something more like pre-ordering a car.
It would allow parents to replace a lost child with one of same gender.
The trauma and grief of having lost a child might be more easily relieved by allowing the couple to have another child of the same gender.
Children are not replacements.
They are individuals, unique in themselves.
Some parents are carriers of known sex-specific diseases.
It is obviously in the child’s interests that they don’t have such a condition.
Medical benefits are outweighed by medical costs.
Pre-implantation genetic diagnosis involves the development of embryos outside the womb, which are then tested for gender.
Gender selection is already occurring by less appropriate means.
In many countries and cultures gender selection happens already, usually by selective abortion or abandonment of unwanted babies.
In the view of many, the new technologies are not morally different from abortion.
in all cases a potential life is taken.
A majority of Americans oppose sex selection for non-medical reasons.
Genetics and Public Policy Center at Johns Hopkins University found that 60 percent of Americans are uncomfortable with sex selection for nonmedical reasons.
Primaries are largely the internal affairs of political parties.
Primaries are not intended to be a fully democratic process.
Primary elections need not be fully democratic.
The United States have developed an institutional tradition of undemocratic mechanisms designed to actually control political processes.
A national primary would violate Party rights to association.
The problem with a national primary is that it would violate many of the interests and powers that are constitutionally and politically necessary to preserve.
Primaries help reveal candidates to the public.

This is undemocratic.

The primary system pushes elections back in the calendar.

This is a phenomenon known as by some as "front loading", in which different states desire to be earlier in the primary process to have a greater impact, thus causing a leap frogging effect backward in the calendar year.
"Frontloading" shifts attention only to the earliest primaries and in this disrupting a real participatory democracy.
Studies have confirmed that the "New Hampshire effect" translates to a shift in focus to the early primaries.

"Abstract: This Article explores the optimal level of income redistribution by examining the potential welfare gains from redistributive tax and spending policies.
Progressive taxes do not increase happiness.
Happiness is fashionable these days.
Progressives assign too much value to money in individual welfare.
Money is not the end all be all of success, welfare, and happiness.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Nothing is perfect, but we should give it a try.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Even if we could not track down each and every individual who downloads music and films, that does not mean that the ban is pointless.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Downloading equals stealing intellectual property.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Downloading is in essence a crime, just like shoplifting; the only difference being that you steal pieces of metal and plastic from a shop together with the song or the film, whereas you download just the "software" from the Internet.

content: Most countries adhere to the Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: established in 1886.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films

content: Downloading is like taking a photo of a famous painting.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: In essence, downloading is using the file without stealing it for ever - just like a copy or a photo of a painting or a sculpture.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Downloading (as outlined above) implies less innovation and entrepreneurship, which in effect impedes economic growth.

topic: Prohibition of downloading music and films
content: Downloading is a crime.

Flag burning does not clearly qualify as an element of "speech" that should receive freedoms.
The law cannot label and protect a limitless variety of conduct as ‘speech’ whenever the person engaging in the conduct intends thereby to express an idea.
The purpose of free speech protection is the advancement of discourse, knowledge, and truth, but flag burning adds nothing to any of these objectives.
The theories of John Milton and J.
Flag burning is a wholly unnecessary means of protest.
It does not convey an opinion that a protestor could not compose more clearly through the conventional media of the spoken or written word.
The conduct of flag burning is often necessary to enter the marketplace of ideas.
Political debate is presently dominated by global news media, and in particular the television bulletins and the front-page photographs of leading newspapers.
The national flag is a symbol of nationhood and national unity that ought to be protected from abuse.
The flag is a unique symbol that has been cherished by the population since the foundation of the Republic.
Flag burning can be a patriotic expression.
The assumption informing this form of protest is that the flag represents national ideals and that these ideals usually require respect.
Patriotic principles do deserve to be questioned and criticized, making potentially un-patriotic acts of flag-burning  more acceptable.
The idea of nationhood and national duty frequently justifies the decision to commit the citizens of a country to war.
Pupils are unable to consent to school prayer.
This is because the school environment does not facilitate the free exercise of consent.
The provision of formal prayer does not invalidate the consent of the child concerned.
Should a child or parent of guardian object to the practice of prayer, the child is entitled to refrain from participation.
School prayer fundamentally undermines the authority of parents.
The Court in Pierce v.
Parents have the authority to prevent children from praying.

First, the primary caregiver of the child can simply direct the child not to attend the prayer, in the alternative or in addition to requesting the school not to permit the child to participate in this activity.
Prohibiting school prayer is compatible with freedom of religion.
The dynamic tension between the free establishment and free exercise clauses of the First Amendment is neither novel nor insoluble.
The prohibition of school prayer violates religious liberty.
The First Amendment precludes state interference in the free exercise of religion.
The slightest involvement of religion is state is dangerous.

The Founding Fathers, the Framers of the Constitution and the Justices of the Supreme Court for over two hundred years have recognised that even seemingly the slightest integration of religion and government "tends to destroy government and degrade religion": Engel v.
There can be no complete separation of Church and State.
As Justice Douglas held in Zorach v.
Religious discrimination is unacceptable and should not be facilitated by a school.
Prayer, in order to be meaningful, a prayer must also be discriminatory between different religious beliefs.
Non-denominational prayer preserves an equilibrium between different faiths.
It can even offer a valuable moment of reflection for the atheist.
Governments should not set moral sexual standards regarding prostitutes.
Prostitution is a highly subjective moral arena, with many believing that it should be legal while others believing the opposite.
Common prostitution is not a biblical conflict.
There is no biblical basis for the anti-sexual traditions taught by tradition bound Christian Churches.
Prostitution is no more immoral than a one night stand.
While sex at it's best is about love and a true connection between two people, humans regularly engage in casual sex for the sheer physical pleasure.
Prostitution is morally wrong.
Sex is a special act, in some senses a sacred act.
Legal prostitution fosters a culture of woman-hating and rape.
Prostitutes are the brunt of many jokes among men, who view women as commodities to be exploited.
Prostitution contributes to adultery, breaks-up families.
Considering that the majority of men who visits prostitutes are married, this should be considered as morally wrong.
Individuals should be able to charge for sex, as it can be freely dispensed.
If sex is not in itself illegal, and can be freely dispensed (and is frequently without regard to any deeper meaning behind it), why is it wrong for a woman to charge for this.
Prostitution simply combines sex and free markets, both legal.
Sex is not illegal.
Prostitutes freely choose their profession.
The majority of prostitutes freely choose their profession.
Governments should not set moral standards on prostitution.
Alison J.
Question of choice, in prostitution, is different for each person.
While it is true some women are coerced into prostitution, that holds no bearing on the women who did choose.
Prostitutes do not have a genuine choice.
They are often encouraged to work in prostitution before they are old enough to make a reasoned decision.
Prostitution driven by a non-voluntary patriarchal culture.
The "choice" to be a prostitute is anchored in this culture and can never be free of it.
Prostitution's destructiveness outweighs upholding freedoms.

Presently, prostitution is overwhelmingly characterized by and directly contributes to human trafficking, oppression, economic coercion and other forms of abuse rather than the affirmation of personal freedom and self-determination.
Individuals must cede some rights for safety, including right to prostitute.
In a democratic society, each individual cedes some rights to the government under the promise that the government will protect them from danger.
Justness of free markets and sex do not justify prostitution.
Although we admit that the free market and having a sex are not illegal on their own, prostitution does equal the combination of the two.
Prostitutes are vulnerable because they lack labor protections.
By legalizing prostitution, a government can help bring these laborers under labor protections offered to other workers.
Legalization is merely a step in reducing sex industry abuses.
Legalization won't cure all of the abuses involved in the sex industry.
Criminalizing the sex industry fosters black market conditions for abuse.
When an industry is criminalized, and yet demand persists, blackmarkets frequently emerge.
Prostitution can relieve the tension that leads to sex crimes.
Sex crimes such as rape or molestation can be seen, in part, as a product of sexual frustrations.
Legalization of prostitution would disrupt the corruption of ‘pimps’.
These individuals subject prostitutes to physical abuse and threats of violence, retain a portion of their earnings, and often encourage them to become addicted to drugs.
Violence against prostitutes is a rampant problems.

The number of violent attacks on prostitutes, including rape and murder, and the considerably greater number of such crimes which are believed to go unreported, suggests that prostitutes themselves are the victims of the most serious criminal offences.
Legalization does not ensure that prostitutes won't continue to work with "pimps".
The legalization of the ‘Bunny Ranch’ in Nevada did not prevent the majority of prostitutes from continuing to work outside of the licensed brothel, and remain dependent on pimps.
The legalization of prostitution will decrease instances of rape.
Numerous empirical studies find that legalization of prostitution decreases instances of rape.
Legal prostitution increases rates of rape.
Prostitution is an industry inherently vulnerable to rape.
Legalized prostitution sanctions a dangerous environment for women.
Governments should not sanction prostitution, as it is an industry with inherent risks to women.
Legalization won't reduce rape, as prostitution is itself a form of rape.
Prostitution is a form of rape.
Legalization would improve the sexual health of prostitutes and their clients.
The activity occurs in a clean and safe environment rather than on the street.
Legalization will increase prostitution and subsequently worsen public health.
When prostitution is lawful and increasingly regarded as socially acceptable, a greater number of people will use prostitutes.
It is impossible to ban prostitution.
Granted that prostitution has been present in societies across the world for thousands of years, governments should recognise that it cannot be eradicated.
Governments must protect the moral and physical health of citizens from prostitution.
Initiating the legalisation of prostitution would grant implicit approval to a dangerous and immoral practice.
Merely because some individuals break a law does not mean that the law itself is at fault.
or that it should be abolished.
Prostitutes have performed a valid social function for thousands of years.
Prostitution actually helps maintain marriages and relationships.
Legalizing prostitution helps clean-up "red light districts".
Legalised brothels improve the quality of life for people who live and work in areas currently frequented by prostitutes.
Prostitution fulfills free-market political philosophies.
The political climate of free market capitalism, free economy, and globalization has created an atmosphere where it is easy for people to establish business that are related to sex.
Prostitution harms the fabric of society.
Sexual intercourse outside of a relationship of love, or even marriage, shows disregard for the sanctity of the sexual act and for the other partner in a relationship.
Prostitutes will continue to work on the street even after legalization.
And, they are unlikely to work nearby to the competition offered by the licensed brothels.
Many libertarian feminists consider that prostitution reflects the independence and dominance of modern women.
The majority of prostitutes are women.
The overwhelming trend of feminism is against prostitution.
The radical feminist school that emerged in the 1990s supports the orthodoxy that prostitution leads to the objectification of women.
Legalizing prostitution would increase government revenue.
A tax on the fee charged by a prostitute, and the imposition of income tax on the earnings of prostitutes would generate revenue.
Prostitution often offers superior money-making opportunities for individuals.
Prostitution often offers individuals a much better option for making money than the alternatives.
An economic benefits from legalizing prostitution cannot take precedence over social harms.
Otherwise we would encourage governments to become involved in other unlawful trades, such as the trafficking of drugs.
Broader legalization of prostitution will reduce concentrated sex tourism.
The problem of a high concentration of ‘sex tourists’ in a small number of destinations will disappear once a larger number of countries legalise prostitution.
Countries that legalize prostitution will suffer from sex tourism.

Relaxed legal controls on prostitution in Thailand, the Philippines and Amsterdam have made these countries attractive for individuals, many of whom the local population would not regard as desirable visitors to a country or city.
Moral standards should stand above economics in banning prostitution.
Economic considerations, while sometimes significant, should not prevent a government from attempting to serve its primary purpose, which is to help provide a level of social and moral guidance.

Govts must address anti-competitive actions such as dumping.

While mediation by an international body is the most effective response to such actions, all nations must reserve the right to enact legislation to impose penalties on foreign companies that endeavor to gain market share through anti-completive practices.
Anti-dumping retaliation is just another form of protectionism.
Anti-dumping retaliation is as unnecessary and economically inefficient as any form of protectionism, and would rarely pass domestic antitrust legislation.
The first duty of every government is to protect its own citizens.
A duty of care is owed to those whose economic prosperity depends upon industrial production.
Prosperity a nation's citizens is enhanced by trade liberalization.
Given that free trade boosts imports as well as exports, given that it enhances competition, it effectively benefits not only the state, but also its citizens.
In times of recession there is pressure to protect declining industries.

Some localities, or countries, are dependent on a single source of manufacturing or agriculture, and allowing the free market to take its course would prolong or deepen an economic depression and drive huge numbers of people out of work.
Protectionism worsens depressions by cushioning firms from their effects.
preventing sufficient diversification of sources of national income, and discouraging retraining to meet the needs of the future.
Developing countries need help in building a competitive economy.
Short-term subsidies to foreign companies are the early stages of import-substitution and economic independence.
Difference between encouraging foreign industry abroad and protectionism at home.
Competition will not merely be over the size of national subsidies, but also on wage costs and looser environmental and safety regulations.
Developing economies hit glass ceiling as they attempt to stabilize economies.
as they are unable to diversify into different markets.
Companies in developing economies suffer from poor stockmarket flexibility and political uncertainty.
as a capitalist mentality needs time to develop.
It is sensible for governments to protect domestic supplies of vital goods, such as oil, food and steel, from the political vicissitudes of world cartels.
which is part of foreign policy and not pure economics.
Worldwide cartels of producers have recently weakened, especially for agricultural goods.
For governments to engage in protectionism merely against international cartels is pure hypocrisy; national security will never be gained by the chimera of economic self-sufficiency.
Protectionism undermines competition, thus slows economic progress down.
Just like, for example, Corn Laws in 19th century in England, protectionist measures harm competitors and drive up prices in home countries.
Public health insurance offers citizens more choices.
"public plan choice gives Americans the opportunity to choose for themselves how they value the strengths and weaknesses of a public, Medicare-like plan and competing private health plans.
Public insurance offers an option to uninsured and struggling.
"Sure, some people are satisfied with their current health insurance.
Nobody will be forced into public insurance.
"Now nobody is proposing that Americans be forced to get their insurance from the government.
Choosing between complicated health insurance plans is difficult.
"there is considerable variation in health insurance products sold, and consumers have great difficulty in making price and quality comparisons.
Private insurers limit choice of doctors as much as public insurance.
"Opponents of a public option say it will deny Americans the right to choose their own doctors.
Private insurers offer sufficient choices.
"Advocates say a government-run insurance program is needed to provide competition for private health insurance.
Public insurance reduces choices by destroying private insurers.

The American Medical Association and Senate Finance Committee: "The introduction of a new public plan threatens to restrict patient choice by driving out private insurers, which currently provide coverage for nearly 70 percent of Americans.
Public health insurance creates two-tiered system .

"The best result of creating a parallel public insurance scheme is that the United States would end up with an explicit two-tier medical system in which privately insured Americans have better access to better medical care.
Government-run health insurance restricts doctor/patient choices.

Republicans argued in a June 2009 letter to President Obama: "Public insurance would be a federal government takeover of our healthcare system, taking decisions out of the hands of doctors and patients and placing them in the hands of a Washington bureaucracy.
Public insurance competes with private insurers, keeps them honest.
President Barack Obama said in March of 2009: "Public insurance gives consumers more choices, and it helps keep the private sector honest, because there’s some competition out there.
Public insurance stimulates competition in a non-competitive industry.

"The arguments around the public plan too often ignore what we believe is the central reason for including a public plan as a component of reform: that health insurance markets today, by and large, are simply not competitive.
Contradictory to argue public option bad, insurers can't compete.
Critics of a public insurance option often argue simultaneously that a government-run insurance option is far worse, and less efficient than private insurance.
Progress with public plan is more important than competition.
Insuring that over 40 million Americans have health insurance is much more important than the ideological notion of "fair competition".
Government will not favor public insurer over private insurers.

"one argument against the public option is that the public plan will always be favored—that there is no way that Congress would let the public plan fail and would find ways to tilt the playing field in its favor, providing it with advantages not afforded private plans.
Public insurance would not kill the private insurance industry.
Probably the best evidence of this is found abroad in places such as France, where both public and private health insurance options exist in a hybrid system.
Public and private insurers can learn from each other.
"public and private plans can learn from each other as they exploit their strengths and remedy their weaknesses.
Insurers/conservatives oppose public insurance because it works.
"A public option does crack the door open for expanding the number of Americans who get their health insurance through the government.
Insurance industry has sufficient competition without public option.
"Advocates say a government-run insurance program is needed to provide competition for private health insurance.
Competition in private insurance can be improved without public plan.

While it is true that the private insurance industry does have some anti-competitive monopolies, conglomerations, and State boundary issues, this does not mean that a more competitive environment cannot be created.
Public insurance is unfair competition for private insurers.
"A public program won't compete in a way that any normal business would recognize.
Public insurance would destroy private insurance industry.
"government-run health insurance would crater the private insurance market, forcing most Americans onto the government plan.
Public option monopoly squeezes health care suppliers, doctors.

"Which raises the question: Would the existence of a dominant government provider of health insurance be good or bad?  A dominant government insurer  could potentially keep costs down by squeezing the suppliers of health care.
Government will favor public insurance.
"It's simply impossible to believe the claims by Sen.
Public insurance meets moral obligation to insure the uninsured.
"A public option health care agency proposed by many Democrats, and an important part of President Barack Obama’s health reform plan, needs a mission statement.
Public insurance is a good alternative for uninsured.
"Sure, some people are satisfied with their current health insurance.
Public insurance protects uninsured from economic calamity.

2009 Statement by the American Nurses Association: "A public health insurance plan would expand choices and help protect against potential economic calamity for individuals or families who are not satisfied with their current health coverage, have difficulty paying for their health care, or cannot find affordable coverage.
Public option weakens private insurers, forcing many out of their plans.
"In a recent analysis, Lewin estimates that enrollment in the public option will reach 131 million people if it is open to everyone and pays Medicare rates.
Employers may dump their employees into public insurance.
"With public insurance there would actually be big changes for many already insured people.
Universal health care in the US is not a "necessity".
Health care is not a right.
Public insurance bureaucracies are better than private ones.
"There is no doubt that the insurance companies and their Republican allies in Congress will fight the inclusion of a public option with every bit of power they can muster.
Insurers should not be trusted with sole control of health insurance.

"As health policy expert Jeanne Lambrew puts the point, the question is not why nonelderly Americans without secure workplace coverage should have the same choice that seniors do: enrolling in a public or private plan.
Public insurance offers a valuable check on private insurance.
"Public plan choice creates an institutional “check and balance,” encouraging private plans to uphold high standards of quality, affordability, and access.
Public insurance is public-private hybrid, not socialized medicine.

"Public option is not an argument for a universal Medicare program, but instead for a “hybrid” approach that builds on the best elements of the present system—large group plans in the public and private sectors—while putting in place a new means by which those without access to secure workplace insurance can choose among health plans that provide strong guarantees of quality, affordable coverage.
Private insurers ration as-much or more than public insurance.
Critics frequently argue that government-run health care involves the government "rationing" health care.
US already has public-private health insurance hybrids.

"A growing number of Americans already get their health care from a public plan, including Medicare, Medicaid and the Children's Health Insurance Plan (the Department of Veterans Affairs, of course, also provides benefits).
Efforts to create a public-private insurance hybrid are in good faith.
There is no reason to believe that the intentions of those that are advocating for a public option are bent on destroying the insurance industry and creating a single-payer system.
Conservatives fear successful public plan undermines their arguments.

"Republicans fear that the public option would work, and therefore undermine their broader arguments about the evil of government and the perfection of the market (and make voters thankful to Democrats to boot).
Public option puts bureaucrats between patients and doctors.
"the public option puts government firmly in the middle of the relationship between patients and their doctors.
Public option is really about making way for a single-payer system.
"the public plan would likely undercut private firms and get an undue share of the market.
Public insurance leads to socialized medicine, rationing, long-lines.
Dr.
Public option forces taxpayers to pay for other people's insurance.
Those that decide to keep their private insurance will gain nothing from the public insurance option, and will actually have to subsidize the public insurance option by paying higher taxes.
Public option is only an ideological symbol for the left.

"The public option has become for the left what "death panels" have become for the right -- an easily understood metaphor that can be used to wage an ideological war over the issue of Big Government, and mostly a sideshow.
US private insurance is inferior to foreign public-private hybrids.

"If we're smart and lucky, we might end up with a system resembling the one they have in France (rated by the World Health Organization as the world's best), where basic health insurance is provided by the government, but most people have supplemental private insurance to fill in the gaps in coverage.
US health insurance is great, but millions can't afford it.

"We have the greatest doctors and medical innovations in the world, but more and more Americans are on the outside looking in to a world of progress and discovery that is denied to them because they cannot afford quality healthcare.
Private insurance puts profit first.
"Putting you first.
Insurance companies insure the healthy.
"The private insurance market is a mess.
Public plan counters insurance company efforts to deny claims.
"Insurance industry employs platoons of adjusters whose sole job is to get out of paying for needed health care services that members thought were covered.
Public health insurance is more reliable and less stressful.

2009 Statement by the American Nurses Association: "What is lacking in our current health care system, driven by for-profit, private insurance companies, is the reliability and predictability of accessible, affordable care.
A public insurance plan can spearhead quality improvements.
"over the last generation, public insurance has pioneered new payment and quality-improvement methods that have frequently set the standard for private plans.
Public-private hybrid leverages strengths of government and markets.
"Public plan choice will allow Americans to realize the benefits of both public and private plans: flexibility and security, innovation and stability, and market and democratic accountability.
Govt cannot run health insurance better than companies.
"Social Security is broke, Medicare is broke, Medicaid is broke, the government is broke.
Public insurance less agile/innovative than private insurance.
Michael J.
Public health insurance creates two-tiers of quality.

"The best result of creating a parallel public insurance scheme is that the United States would end up with an explicit two-tier medical system in which privately insured Americans have better access to better medical care.
Public insurance would stifle medical innovation and advancement.
"I've spent three decades working in or near biopharmaceutical research and development.
Public insurance option is less costly than private insurance.

"Real health care reform that includes a new public health insurance option could adopt the kind of payment reforms that would start to “hold down long-term growth in health spending' and encourage providers to deliver care more efficiently.
Public insurance delivers same quality insurance at a lower price.
"COST-CONTROL ADVANTAGES OF PUBLIC INSURANCE.
Public insurance option has lower administrative costs.
"the critics say the public plan starts off with an unfair advantage because it's likely to have lower administrative costs.
Public option cuts obscene profits of insurance establishment.

"The ONLY reason there is consideration of continuing the failed, greedy, destructive corporate insurance system is because the few who get rich off of it are paying off politicians to keep things they way they are.
Public insurance would not waste money on advertising.
"JUST IMAGINE: "Fireworks Night" at the Phillies' game brought to you by .
Public insurance would not waste money on lobbying.
"government-paid insurance surely wouldn't be forking over the estimated $1.
Public insurer can best negotiate down drug prices.
"Private insurers say a public option would have an unfair advantage in achieving this goal.
Greater prevention and health through public insurance saves money.
A public insurance option will guarantee universal coverage, and will ensure that people receive good preventive care, instead of waiting to see if they can ride out their health issues on their own.
Public insurance protects uninsured from calamity.

2009 Statement by the American Nurses Association: "A public health insurance plan would expand choices and help protect against potential economic calamity for individuals or families who are not satisfied with their current health coverage, have difficulty paying for their health care, or cannot find affordable coverage.
Expensive public insurance option would worsen national debt.
"the public option is far too expensive.
Public insurance costs will grow as private insurance is pushed out.

The American Medical Association argued in June of 2009 letter to the Senate Finance Committee: "If private insurers are pushed out of the market, the group said, 'the corresponding surge in public plan participation would likely lead to an explosion of costs that would need to be absorbed by taxpayers.
Public insurance will be used excessively at greater cost.
"Excess Use.
Public insurance inefficiencies can be hidden by taxpayer-funding.

"The central problem with proposals to create a new government program, however, is not that government is less efficient than private insurers, but that government can hide its inefficiencies and draw consumers away from private insurance, despite offering an inferior product.
Public insurance option will increase taxes, drag-down economy.
"Who covers the rest? Government passes the bill for the outstanding balance to providers and families not covered by government programs.
Low admin costs of public insurance don't mean lower overall costs.

Benjamin Sasse, a former official at the Department of Health and Human Services: "As the case of Medicare's anemic anti-fraud efforts painfully illustrates, less management and lower administrative costs do not necessarily mean the program is really less costly.
Public insurance may force private insurance rate increase.

"As people gravitate to 'free' or heavily subsidized care, the inevitably explosive costs will be covered in part with increased outlays to keep premiums artificially low or even offer extra benefits.
Medicare out-performs private insurance, is a model for public insurance.

"The case made in this brief is that this menu of health plans must include a good public plan modeled after Medicare if the broad goals of reform—universal insurance and improved value—are to be achieved.
Costs of Medicare/Medicaid show public insurance waste.
"The largest existing public health programs — Medicare and Medicaid — are the main reason that the government’s long-term finances are in shambles.
Public option is better way to universal care than mandates.
"most major health insurance markets are dominated by two or three companies so there is no real competition -particularly with respect to price.
Mandates wrongly give insurers millions of new customers.

"Once everyone is required by mandates to buy insurance, the companies can have a field day raising prices and profits using the government to guarantee they are paid - either through subsidies or the imposition of fines.
Universal care better achieved with mandates than public option.

"One argument is that a government-sponsored plan is needed so that Americans with modest income and chronic medical problems -- the kind of people who are literally uninsurable -- can be assured of getting coverage.
Public option is needed because regulating insurers is insufficient.
"to have a workable system without the public option, you need to have effective regulation of the insurers.
Status quo of insurance company control is unacceptable.
"In the coming weeks, the cynics and the naysayers will continue to exploit fear and concerns for political gain.
Healthcare reform/regulation can succeed without public option.

"One argument is that a government-sponsored plan is needed so that Americans with modest income and chronic medical problems -- the kind of people who are literally uninsurable -- can be assured of getting coverage.
Public insurance is an essential and nonnegotiable part of reform.
Howard Dean told the Washington Post: "The worst thing that could happen is to pass a bill without a public option.
Public insurance option is a reasonable compromise.

The public insurance option is a compromise between the very prominent extremes of those that want the continuation of the status quo - with solely private insurance companies in charge of health care - and those that advocate for a single-payer system, in which insurance companies simply cease to exist.
Public option is next best option to single-payer health care.

"Although the public option wasn't the topic of a great deal of discussion during the campaign, for many progressives it amounts to a beautiful jewel hidden amidst a pile of compromise and disappointment.
Pursuit of bipartisan reform should not hold up public option.
"What we really need is a 'bipartisan' health-reform bill -- and if Democrats act properly, they could get one.
Public option jeopardizes passing healthcare reform legislation.

"I've spent the last 30 years trying to achieve affordable health coverage for all Americans, so it's frustrating to see the obsession with a 'public plan' making it impossible for reasonable people from both parties to come together.
There are not enough votes to pass a public insurance plan.
Independent US senator Joseph Lieberman from Connecticut: "the votes are not there for a public health plan, government-run option.
Public insurance saves many businesses cost of health insurance.

"big business and small business can finally be persuaded that a strong public insurance program is in their interest, since it will save them money (their prior opposition to health care reform has always been more ideological than economic).
Public insurance makes workers healthier and more productive.

A public insurance option will guarantee universal coverage, and will ensure that people with medical conditions receive the preventive care they need, which saves money in long-term health care costs.
Public insurance will be paid for by taxes on businesses.
"Mr.
Public insurance will give doctors/hospitals millions of new patients.
It is surprising that the American Medical Association would complain about over forty million Americans suddenly having insurance so that they can pay doctors and hospitals for health care services.
Hospitals may be overwhelmed by new public-insurance patients.
American Medical Association said in a June 2009 letter to the Senate Finance Committee that it "cannot support any plan design that mandates physician participation.

The American Medical Association wrote in a June 2009 letter to the Senate Finance Committee that the association, "cannot support any plan design that mandates physician participation.
Public insurance will discourage people from becoming doctors.

Senator John Rockefeller.

"As prospects fade for a public, or government-run, option as part of health-care reform, key senators are considering another model to create competition for private insurers: member-owned, nonprofit health cooperatives.
US polls find a majority favor a public insurance option.

Divisions on public vs. private healthcare suggests a hybrid.

Puerto Ricans deserve full political rights and citizenship.
"They should not have to wait any longer to gain constitutionally-guaranteed citizenship with full political rights and responsibilities.
Puerto Ricans have earned statehood through support of US.

Puerto Rico as colony is unacceptable.
"We cannot continue to operate a colony, forcing U.
Puerto Rico has waited for too long for full citizenship.
"Puerto Ricans have been waiting over 100 years for equal treatment; from 1898 when the United States wrested control of the island from Spain following the Spanish-American War, until today.
Puerto Ricans have rejected statehood many times now.
Puerto Ricans have already made their voices heard on this issue many times since the late 1960's.
Puerto Ricans are already considered Americans.
"Puerto Ricans are already considered to be American citizens who can freely come and go between the island and the states like all Americans.
Puerto Rican statehood would require changing the US flag.

English is not a problem for Puerto Rico statehood.

Puerto Rico violates idea of states with English as official language.

Statehood offers huge opportunities to Puerto Ricans.

Puerto Rico would burden US welfare system.

Puerto Rico commonwealth status not meant to be permanent.

Puerto Rico would no longer have miss universe rep.

Democrats want Puerto Rican statehood to gain votes.

Random sobriety tests are a just public safety intervention.

Robert Solomon, a law professor at the University of Western Ontario and the director of legal policy for MADD Canada, argues that implementing random sobriety tests on roads would be a just impingement on Canadian's lives because of the death and injury toll drunk driving is inflicting there: “We have one of the worst records for impaired driving of any comparable democracies.
Operating dangerous vehicles requires giving up some rights.
The U.
Random breath tests are done to public vehicle drivers.

It can hardly be called an invasion of privacy or an investigation without due cause, because random tests are routinely carried out by many train and bus companies and are being introduced on airlines as well.
RBT just an extension of already strict driving regulations.
Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD): "Driving is a heavily regulated, licensed activity occurring on public roads.
"Reasonable suspicion" too high standard for detecting drunk drivers.

"Unless a driver admits to drinking, the police currently need clear visible signs that the driver has consumed alcohol or was driving in an impaired manner in order to demand a roadside screening test.
RBT has been successfully implemented in many modern democracies.
"Random breath testing has been in place in most comparable democracies for as long as 30 years.
Random sobriety tests amount to unreasonable searches.
"In a free society it should be the case that a citizen can move about at will without ever being hindered by the police.
Randomly testing employees is different than testing citizens.
People who have to take random breath tests to drive trucks or fly planes as part of their jobs are taking the test as part of their job.
Random breath tests are an inconvenience and make people angry.
Generally speaking, inconveniencing innocent people and introducing random sobriety tests into their lives will make many people angry.
Utility of stopping every car doesn't justify breach of rights.
Dissenting US Supreme Court justices argued in a case that struck down an effort to ban random drug tests in Michigan: "That stopping every car might make it easier to prevent drunken driving.
"Random" breath tests likely to be implemented unequally.

Canadian Liberal MP Ujjal Dosanjh and the former attorney general of British Columbia and a member of the House justice committee: "I wouldn’t want the east side of Vancouver monitored more than the west side of Vancouver because there is a clear economic division in the city.
Innocent do have something to fear from unjust searches.
"The 'logic' that the innocent have nothing to fear from such searches rests on the presumption that there is never a miscarriage of justice by the authorities.
Random sobriety stops set-up unjust detection of other crimes.
"this would seem to open up a huge can of legal worms.
Random breath tests help deter drunk driving.
Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD): "RBT deters impaired driving by increasing the perceived chance of detection.
People drive drunk because they can get away with it.
Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD): "Millions of Canadians continue to drink and drive because they can do so with little fear of being stopped, let alone charged and convicted.
Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents, save lives.

The Centers for Disease Control, in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report, found that in general, the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20% in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not.
RBT has been successful in countries that implement it.
"The Australian RBT programs, which have been the most extensively studied, have resulted in dramatic reductions in impaired driving deaths and injuries.
Random alcohol tests are more effective than alternative measures.

The federal Justice Department of Canada moved to implement Random Breath Testing (RBT), concluding: "a system of random checks is more effective than a combination of other measures such as a lower threshold for blood alcohol level and more frequent RIDE checkpoints.
Random breath testing doesn't necessarily lower drunk driving.
Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures.
Little evidence random alcohol tests deter drunk driving.
There is a dearth of research regarding the deterrent effect of checkpoints.
Repeat drunk drivers unlikely to respond to RBT deterrence.
"One statistic the MAD bunch doesn’t like to mention is the fact that half of the people killed by drunk drivers have at least double the legal blood alcohol limit.
Everyone knows drunk driving is wrong.
Of course drink driving is wrong.
Most drunk drivers aren't caught through random breath tests.
The majority of people caught drink driving have not been from random breath tests.
Good use of police to cultivate awareness on drunk driving.
Guaranteeing a culture of awareness that the driver might be subjected to testing – and thereby ensuring people drink responsibly – can be achieved by random testing.
Random breath tests worthwhile.
You cannot say that random breath testing is a waste of money.
Police are already performing random alcohol stops.

In reality, even where random testing is not allowed, most officers realize that this is necessary – that is why they often make up reasons to stop people (like claiming they were driving erratically) in order to carry out a de facto random testing system already.
Police time is better spent pursing proper offenders.
Police time is better spent pursuing those about whom there are concrete suspicions, rather than trawling society at large in the hope of turning something up.
Individuals should be able to judge whether they are okay to drive.

It is still legal to have a drink and then drive – but the culture of nanny state control is increasingly meaning that self-righteous moral pundits condemn people for doing so, when in truth it should be up to the individual to judge whether they are ok to drive.
Surveillance already exists - and for good reasons.
Surveillance is nothing unusual in today's world, especially if you consider security cameras and checks.
Reality shows are immoral.
Reality entertainment is based on display of sex, violence, humiliation, bad habits, and other - on TV - morally unacceptable behaviour.
Watching reality shows is immoral.
Not only that reality shows as such are immoral, but watching them is even worse.
TV shows merely reflect society's demands.
There is nothing immoral about reality shows, but rather about the society which demands them.
Reality shows were designed to show stereotypes.

Reality shows were designed for people to laugh at stereotypes, which (unconsciously) enhance these beliefs, although participants usually come from extreme backgrounds or are told to behave in extreme ways.
Reality shows bring taboos into spotlight.
Shocking reality shows are valuable, because they force the society to think about stereotypes, taboos, and biases.
There are no unique harms.
Immoral content, erosion of cultural values, enhancement of stereotypes, and other possible harms are innate to a huge number of scripted shows, not to mention websites.
Revenues from reality shows can be used for good purposes.
Advertising, product placement, and other sources of reality TV revenues can be used to fund more "edifying" programmes.
Not all reality shows are centered around sex and violence.
In fact, there are many reality entertainment programmes that educate people.
Amusement is a purpose of television.
Reality shows help us let off steam and relax, which - after all - is one of the main purposes of television.
Scripted shows are further from reality.
Precisely because reality shows are not scripted, they reflect the reality the best, as they are not a product of someone's imagination.

Speech acts lead to physical acts.
Thus pornography, hate speech and political polemic are causally linked to rape, hate crimes, and insurrection.
The link between speech acts and physical acts is a false one.
People who commit hate crimes are likely to have read hate speech, people who commit sex crimes are likely to have watched pornography but not necessarily the other way around.
Exposing "bad" views by allowing them to be voiced increases the likelihood that they will be defeated.
Exposing pornography, hate speech and political polemic (extreme nationalism etc.
